name: Slick Shot
overview:
Slick Shot was produced by Grand Products (renamed to Incredible Technologies shortly after this game came out) in 1990.

Players choose one of two billiard games: Slickshot or 9 ball. Using a real cue stick and ball on a small pool table surface, a player must shoot the ball into the game cabinet to simulate the shot on the video screen. Infrared sensors on the table slate calculate the speed and direction the ball is traveling.
